definition: Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: It was, Houllier said with a completely straight face, my tribute to Rigobert.
sentences.chinese: 侯利亞完全不露表情的臉說，那是我對桑治的敬意。

sentences.english: Use them respectfully in both oral and written communication.
sentences.chinese: 充滿敬意地在口頭和書面交流中使用它們。

sentences.english: Please accept this little gift as my esteem for you.
sentences.chinese: 奉上這小小的禮物，以表達我對您的崇高敬意。

sentences.english: In Washington, DC, Congress is holding a bicameral tribute;
sentences.chinese: 在華盛頓特區，國會兩院將表示他們的敬意。

sentences.english: I salute Yihai Chen's bravery, as well as his craftsmanship.
sentences.chinese: 對於陳義海的勇氣，以及他的技藝，我深表敬意。

sentences.english: A hundred planes will fly by the castle as a mark of respect.
sentences.chinese: 100架飛機將飛過城堡以示敬意。

sentences.english: The other teachers gave him their highest respect.
sentences.chinese: 其他老師都對他致以最高的敬意。

sentences.english: We always stand when the National Anthem is played in deference to the Queen.
sentences.chinese: 奏國歌時我們總是站立着，以此表示對女王的敬意。

sentences.english: After the funeral, all the residents of Wisteria Lane came to pay their respects.
sentences.chinese: 葬禮之後，柴藤巷所有的居民都來表達他們的敬意。

sentences.english: LLS: I found that everyone had so much respect for each other.
sentences.chinese: 我發現每一個人對彼此都是那麼地充滿敬意。

sentences.english: I can't kill a duck, But it's duck soup to a cook.
sentences.chinese: 我可以向您免費提供一些牡蠣湯，算廚師的一點敬意。

sentences.english: We all stood for his coming.
sentences.chinese: 我們對他的到來，起立表示敬意。

sentences.english: We commemorate the tough and affordable red, blue, and white bags used by workers and movers around the world.
sentences.chinese: 我們對勞動人民使用過的紅藍白膠袋心懷敬意。

sentences.english: In bows and curtsies, it's the lower-status person who indicates that they're going to make a reverence first.
sentences.chinese: 行禮致意時，總由身份低的人，先行一步，表示敬意。

sentences.english: People pay respects to the dead and clean the graves on the 5th of April.
sentences.chinese: 四月五日，人們掃墓並向過世的人表達敬意。

definition: to express/to present/to extend/to tender (greetings, thanks etc)
to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
to admire/to revere/to look up to
to salute/to pay one's respects to/to pay tribute to/to pay homage to
